project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
... and anywhere else that issues could otherwise be opened in a modal window.

Rationale:

There are currently two ways of working with the board.
- (1) an issue is opened in the same tab and replaces the planning board
- (2) it is opened in a modal window and obscures the board.

Both options leave me unable to see the planning board side-by-side with the issue.  In addition, using the modal window isn't exactly fast...

To achieve the desired effect, if modal is enabled, I have to:
- open the issue
- wait...
- middle-click the issue Id in the modal window (opens in a new tab)
- wait
- close the window
- wait...

That's a lot more waiting that I want to have to do!

Every modern browser going nowadays supports tabbed browsing.  Using this would allow multiple issues to be opened concurrently for purposes of cross-referencing them, linking them, etc.  The speed gains would also be appreciated.

This is a very minor change that would make greenhopper just a bit more useable
fields.summary: General option allowing issues to be opened into a new tab from the planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently use jira and greenhopper in our project and we are facing a difficulty. We use the greenhoper ranking to prioritize the issue. The queue/line of issues provided by greenhopper fulfill our needs except on one point, the initialization. 

When a new issue is created, currently the issue is put in the last position of the queue. However, it could be usefull is there is a rule on creation to help greenhopper putting the issue on the right position. 
For example, in our company, we would like that the issue is put on the queue according to the following criteria :
- the priority
- the creation date if the priority are equals
- if priority and date are equals, the last created on last position

This way, the first priorization is automatic and the managers just have to reorder the queue if needed but a huge part of the work is automatically made by the custom field. 

Is it possible to associate this kind of rules for the greenhopper ranking custom fields so that some fields could be used to calculate the initial order in the queue ?
fields.summary: Add a setting to modify the initialization of JIRA Software ranking

fields.description:
e have an issue that is affecting all projects. We have lost a lot of fields on creating new issue or editing. All projects have the same screen that contain the following fields:
-          Summary
-          Affects Versions
-          Components
-          Iteration End Date              
-          Assign To
-          Start Date
-          Priority                                
-          Comment
-          Viewable By
No description, reporter, environement etc.
There was no changes to project screen schemas or fields. 
This requires immideate attention as it affects production system

fields.description: Currently if I expand a card, click edit, and then double click existing text (to select a word) the card is collapsed again. fields.description:
We are currently evaluating JIRA + GreenHopper as a replacement for VersionOne tool currently used.

We have a large community broken down into multiple scrum teams.

I'd like to be able to look at the burndown of the various scrum teams we have working within a sprint. Currently the burndown/issues etc, almost everything in JIRA is broken down by version which we have defined as a sprint. We'd like to be able to look at sprint burndown overall and then drill down into issues and burndown by scrum team.

We would like our users to be able to modify the start/end dates on the Chartboard.  It would be nice if the Administrator had the option to allow or not allow users to change the dates.

Thanks!

fields.description:
If Component is a required field, the quick card creation should make it required also - currently it does not do this.

Also, if JIRA is configured so that the "Automatic" Assignee is a component lead, quick card creation should default to this person too instead of the project lead.

On TaskBoard. If moving an issue on a column with only one status and one resolution
the Card pop up should not be shown

fields.description:
Greenhoppers session breaks, this happens only when using greenhopper plugin, normal jira usage works fine. Jira ask often after greenhopper operation to login again. This seems to make GH fully unusable for some our GH users.

In the log there is following type of errors.

2008-09-30 10:24:41,677 http-8080-Processor15 ERROR [500ErrorPage] Exception caught in 500 page User 'null' does not have permission to see issue 'QUIT-246'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The burndown chart of our project shows incorrect values. The original estimate has been filled in correctly, but the plugin does not take into account these values.

E.g. issue MIR-9 has an original estimate of 22.4, no work has been logged, but Greenhopper displays 0.75 in yesterday's remaining estimates.
fields.summary: Burndown shows incorrect values

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a custom field called Team that has multiple contexts, one per project, because the list of teams differs per project.

When using the Quick Create button on the Planning Board, the Select drop-down (Team in our case) uses the default options.  It should instead use the context for the current project.  Should be a pretty simple API usage change.
fields.summary: Quick Card Create screen does not display correct Single-select custom field options with per-project contexts.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Theme will be represented as a indexed card displaying:
# A description
# Time Tracking stats
# Watched fields stats

One of the main objective of this story is to fulfill the "Theme" as expressed by Mike Cohn.
fields.summary: As a manager I would like to be able to group some issues under a "Theme"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The enterprise version of JIRA has Project Categories and it would be great if Greenhopper would support this on Task Board. So a developer could not only see his/her tasks for one project but for multiple ones.

We have many projects and it is very inconvinient to check them all one-by-one by selecting them from dropdown menu just to see if there is a task waiting to be done. 

It is inconsistent if one applies already created JIRA filter, which includes criterion on available projects and then GreenHopper plugin disregards this with project selected from drop down selection in the task board.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like my Task Board to display multiple projects at once

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Jean-Christophe,

I think this will be a big plus for you. Let me know if you want to discuss in detail

This is something that Jeff  keeps talking about.. 

D you think we can have this in greenhopper  somehow?

This is a chart about original estimate in hours or story  points (in our case hours):
Current open - sum of open original  estimates
Daily closed - sum of  original estimates closed  daily
Total closed - sum of daily closed
Current verification - sum of  original estimates in resolved 
Daily open - sum of  original  estimates opened daily
 

Rather than daily we'd like it weekly.   Let me know when we can discuss in more detail

fields.summary: Error when accessing any Greenhopper Tabs in Jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA 3.13 introduced new elements to the JIRA header, namely the filters and issue history drop downs.

However the GreenHopper drop down replaces the header with its own and hence it lose the new elements

This was reported by a JIRA customer in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15629

This may be fixed in the new 3.02 but I have seen it.  jira.atlassian.com is running GreenHopper 3.0.2beta-jira313.

The new header elements are in fact plugin points and perhaps GreenHopper could use them to provide its drop down list it inserts.

Or perhaps JIRA needs a new "ins3ert header content" plugin point to allow people to insert content instead of replacing the header.
fields.summary: The JIRA header is not honoured, especially the new 3.13 Filters / History drop downs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I had this report today:

{quote}
I have configured my JIRA project to show the assignee when using list view on the taskboard.
If you hover over the area where you would expect the assignee to show, you see the name popup, but it doesn't show without hovering over the area.
Doing scrum sessions with lots of issues and using the smartboard  is not very user friendly as you want to see as many issues as possible.
You really would like to see the number, summary, assignee and the amount of remaining story points.
{quote}

It would be nice if the TASK BOARD list mode could be configured.

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: TASK BOARD list view mode not configurable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

I had this request today.

{quote}filling our planning board for the next SCRUM, we have the following problem:
1) Filter issues on : Severity, priority 
2) This shows a list in the best order for us to solve the issues.
3) We would like to rank this list for top to bottom, to reflect this selection in our planning board. For this we would have to be able to batch change the rankings of the JIRA issues. 
When we currently go to the planning board, the sorting order does not reflect the sorted order in the filter. Having a lot of issues open, it takes a lot of work to manually change the ranking in the planning board. Is there a clever method of adjusting the ranking to reflect the filter sort order.
{quote}

It seems to me it would be nice to be able to say "Take the order the issues appear to me in right now and set this as the ranked order", with appropriate warning and permission restriction of course.

Cheers,

Ximon

{panel:title=Workaround}To work around this issue in GreenHopper 6.1.3 or later, please try the following steps:
# Determine your preferred rank order field (for example, I'll use Story Points)
# Create quickfilters for each valid Story Point value - ex, Story Points = 1, Story Points = 2, Story Points = 3, Story Points = 5, etc
# Enable the quick filter that corresponds with the lowest-rank tickets
# Select all Cards shown
# Disable quick filter
# Right click one of the Cards that are still selected
# Select Rank To Bottom
# Repeat steps 3-7 until complete{panel}

This was originally reported at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15598. 

On the task board in summary mode I open a task in progress. after closing I get a series of JS errors. Object Doesn't Support this property or method. If I hit f5 or refresh they go away temporarily. Using a mouse with a scroll wheel causes even more JS errors. Basically I can not open any tasks without getting a ton of JS errors. This is repeatable on many machines.

fields.summary: In list mode if I update a card the board refreshes and my issue is back in list mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'm using GreenHopper 3.0.1 for Jira, and when the Auto Refresh checkbox in the Planning Board is checked, any open dialogs (e.g. creating a subtask) are closed when the board is refreshed.

To reproduce:
* View a set of issues (in my case in List view with the Version Context)
* Check the _Auto_ checkbox next to _Refresh_
* Open a new subtask creation dialog by clicking the (+) on an issue
* Type some information in
* Wait a little while

What I'd expect to happen is for the refresh to happen in the background, not happen at all, or ideally be deferred until I close the issue creation dialog.
fields.summary: Auto Refresh closes open dialogs in Planning Board

fields.description:
Hi - I was just on your website and noticed some typos on various pages (I didn't check all, just browsing):

apppropriate
Entreprise
appplications
Pyxis Technologies Inc.. (extra period)
integretion
taht
environnement
verion
suprises
therefor
GreenHooper

Not to mention links that are broken. e.g. from http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/en/services/ click on "web site" and link to "http://www.pyxis-tech.com/en/" is not found. Link "Pyxis Technologies" to "http://pyxis-tech.com/en/" is also not found. I did a quick broken link report and I attach findings for you (I didn't check them all).

Cheers,

Neal

Don't take this the wrong way, but as a QA manager looking into the possibility of installing GreenHopper on our next JIRA upgrade, these kinds of errors on your company website indicate to me a lack of detail which may make its way into the software you provide.

Hopefully Greenhopper respects JIRA field and screen schemes on future version.

BR,

fields.description:
Hi JC,

We have a burndown chart showing a burndown curve beginning at 121 hours. In the chart data (downloaded using the link on the chart board) the data shows the original estimate dropping from 40 to 16, but that change is not shown on the curve. On digging into the issue history we found that those 24 hours were spent in a previous sprint and so it makes sense that the chart doesn't show the drop, BUT the chart is using the original estimate of the issue (40 hours) in determining the start height of the burndown curve, instead of the estimate remaining at the start of the current sprint (16 hours).

Is this a bug or are we missing something? This is at least unexpected.

Cheers,

Ximon

fields.description:
GreenHopper (ENTERPRISE, Version: 3.0-jira310)

See attached screen shots for example.

Steps to reproduct
1. Create PBI
2. Create 3 sub-tasks of the PBI
3. Put PBI into version
4. Change parent of one sub-task to PBI that is not in the same version.
4a. Change version of moved sub-task to match the version of new parent PBI
5. Go to Planning Board for parent of all versions

Notice the the moved sub-task is still show under the original parent even though the correct parent is displayed.

fields.description:
QUick Create is great, but since GreenHopper lacks a built-in Team concept, it is not as useful as it should be.  When you create a backlog item you nearly always know the team it is meant for, and so you can use Quick Create to create them but then have to turn around and edit them all again to set the custom field Team we have.

I still think the reason GH is great is because you folks know scrum and are building  a tool you use yourself.  But the problem is you are small, and don't exercise Scrum as a larger group would with multiple teams.  You don't need a Team concept...there is only one team.  So I just have a fear these kind of requirements will get pushed down the list or forgotten.  I will keep logging Improvements though ;).  thx.

fields.description:
Example:

JIRA issue summary contains the word <sometag>.

The GH card summary field will contain all the other words but <sometag> will be missing.

I am not asking for HTML intpretation of tags, I am saying that sometimes we refer to something which is itself a tag, e.g. if you were developing a web browser you might create an issue called "Fix bug with nested <table.>s." or similar. < and > are valid characters in JIRA field values.
fields.summary: GreenHopper strips < tags > out of JIRA field values
